page.title: 11Leisure Time
page.content: Leisure time activities for the local people are very varied. Most popular were sports such as swimming, squash, bowling and golf. Gardening is also a very popular pastime. Hobbies such as arts, crafts, reading, Do-it-Yourself and television are enjoyed by many people, particularly the elderly who are confined to their homes. Countryside hobbies are also popular. These include walking bird watching, horse riding and angling. Some residents are members of organisations which encourage countryside pursuits eg. Conservation Trust, Watch, Royal Society for the Protection of Birds and the Pony Club. The village halls provide activities such as dancing and some indoor sports. For other sporting facilities local people have to travel to surrounding towns and villages.
